text.6: يٰٓاَيُّهَا الْاِنْسَانُ اِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ اِلٰى رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلٰقِيْهِۚ
text.10: وَاَمَّا مَنْ اُوْتِيَ كِتٰبَهٗ وَرَاۤءَ ظَهْرِهٖۙ
text.15: بَلٰىۛ اِنَّ رَبَّهٗ كَانَ بِهٖ بَصِيْرًاۗ
text.21: وَاِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْاٰنُ لَا يَسْجُدُوْنَ ۗ ۩
text.25: اِلَّا الَّذِيْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَعَمِلُوا الصّٰلِحٰتِ لَهُمْ اَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُوْنٍ ࣖ

text.2: dan patuh kepada Tuhannya, dan sudah semestinya patuh,
text.4: dan memuntahkan apa yang ada di dalamnya dan menjadi kosong,
text.5: dan patuh kepada Tuhannya, dan sudah semestinya patuh.
text.6: Wahai manusia! Sesungguhnya kamu telah bekerja keras menuju Tuhanmu, maka kamu akan menemui-Nya.
text.7: Maka adapun orang yang catatannya diberikan dari sebelah kanannya,
text.8: maka dia akan diperiksa dengan pemeriksaan yang mudah,
text.9: dan dia akan kembali kepada keluarganya (yang sama-sama beriman) dengan gembira.
text.10: Dan adapun orang yang catatannya diberikan dari sebelah belakang,
text.12: Dan dia akan masuk ke dalam api yang menyala-nyala (neraka).
text.13: Sungguh, dia dahulu (di dunia) bergembira di kalangan keluarganya (yang sama-sama kafir).
text.14: Sesungguhnya dia mengira bahwa dia tidak akan kembali (kepada Tuhannya).
text.15: Tidak demikian, sesungguhnya Tuhannya selalu melihatnya.
text.16: Maka Aku bersumpah demi cahaya merah pada waktu senja,
text.17: demi malam dan apa yang diselubunginya,
text.19: sungguh, akan kamu jalani tingkat demi tingkat (dalam kehidupan).
text.20: Maka mengapa mereka tidak mau beriman?
text.21: Dan apabila Al-Qur'an dibacakan kepada mereka, mereka tidak (mau) bersujud,
text.23: Dan Allah lebih mengetahui apa yang mereka sembunyikan (dalam hati mereka).
text.24: Maka sampaikanlah kepada mereka (ancaman) azab yang pedih,
text.25: kecuali orang-orang yang beriman dan mengerjakan kebajikan, mereka akan mendapat pahala yang tidak putus-putusnya.

text.1: When the sky is split open,
text.2: And it listens to its Lord, as it must,
text.3: And when the earth is flattened out,
text.4: And casts out what is within it and becomes empty,
text.5: And it listens to its Lord, as it must.
text.6: O mankind! Indeed, you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion, and you will meet Him.
text.7: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
text.8: He will be judged with an easy account,
text.9: And will return to his family in joy.
text.10: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
text.11: He will cry out, "Woe to me!"
text.12: And he will enter into a blazing Fire.
text.13: Indeed, he was among his people joyful [in his worldly life].
text.14: Indeed, he thought he would never return [to his Lord].
text.15: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Observing.
text.16: So I swear by the twilight glow,
text.17: And by the night and what it envelops,
text.18: And by the moon when it is at its full,
text.19: That you will surely pass from stage to stage.
text.20: So what is [the matter] with them that they do not believe,
text.21: And when the Quran is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allah]?
text.23: And Allah is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
text.24: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,
text.25: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.

text.1: Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa apabila langit terbelah karena telah rusak hubungan bagian-bagiannya dengan rusaknya peraturan alam semesta pada hari Kiamat nanti, disebabkan perbenturan bintang-bintang di langit karena masing-masing mempunyai daya tarik tersendiri. Oleh karena itu, rusaklah peraturan alam semesta dan terjadilah gumpalan-gumpalan awan yang gelap gulita yang timbul di beberapa tempat di angkasa luar, dan langit itu akan patuh kepada apa-apa yang diperintahkan Allah. Ia pantas menjadi patuh karena dialah makhluk Tuhan yang senantiasa berada dalam kekuasaan-Nya.
text.2: Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa apabila langit terbelah karena telah rusak hubungan bagian-bagiannya dengan rusaknya peraturan alam semesta pada hari Kiamat nanti, disebabkan perbenturan bintang-bintang di langit karena masing-masing mempunyai daya tarik tersendiri. Oleh karena itu, rusaklah peraturan alam semesta dan terjadilah gumpalan-gumpalan awan yang gelap gulita yang timbul di beberapa tempat di angkasa luar, dan langit itu akan patuh kepada apa-apa yang diperintahkan Allah. Ia pantas menjadi patuh karena dialah makhluk Tuhan yang senantiasa berada dalam kekuasaan-Nya.
text.3:
Selanjutnya Allah menerangkan bahwa bila bumi dan gunung-gunung hancur berkeping-keping sehingga menjadi rata dan mengeluarkan apa yang ada di dalam "perut"-nya, maka hal itu adalah karena ketundukannya pada perintah Allah dan kepatuhan melakukan kehendak-Nya.

Dalam ayat-ayat lain, Allah berfirman:

Apabila bumi diguncangkan dengan guncangan yang dahsyat, dan bumi telah mengeluarkan beban-beban berat (yang dikandung)nya. (az-Zalzalah/99: 1-2)

Dan apabila kuburan-kuburan dibongkar. (al-Infithar/82: 4)

Maka tidakkah dia mengetahui apabila apa yang di dalam kubur dikeluarkan. (al-'Adiyat/100: 9)

Untuk tafsir pada kalimat "langit terbelah" di atas, dapat dilihat kembali pada telaah ilmiah Surah al-Insyiqaq/84:1-5, lihat pula telaah ilmiah Surah al-haqqah/69:16 dan Surah al-Infithar/82:1. Kemudian, kalimat yang mengikutinya: "¦dan patuh kepada Tuhannya, dan sudah semestinya langit itu patuh", mengandung pengertian bahwa kejadian itu berlangsung menurut sunatullah, yaitu menurut hukum-hukum Allah yang ada di alam semesta ini. Pengertian "bumi diratakan, dan memuntahkan apa yang ada di dalamnya dan menjadi kosong" adalah bahwa bumi benar-benar luluh lantak, baik terjadinya benturan dengan planet atau benda langit lainnya, karena hilang atau kacaunya gaya gravitasi. Luluh lantaknya bumi inilah yang juga menyebabkan seluruh isi bumi dimuntahkan dan menjadikan isi bumi kosong. Kemudian, kalimat yang mengikutinya: "¦dan patuh kepada Tuhannya, dan sudah semestinya bumi itu patuh", mengandung pengertian bahwa kejadian itu berlangsung menurut sunatullah, yaitu menurut hukum-hukum Allah yang ada di alam semesta ini.

text.6: Dalam ayat ini, Allah mengungkapkan bahwa manusia dalam masa hidupnya bekerja dengan sungguh-sungguh untuk mencapai cita-citanya. Setiap langkah manusia sesungguhnya menuju kepada akhir hidupnya, yaitu mati. Hal ini berarti kembali kepada Allah. Oleh karena itu, manusia akan mengetahui tentang baik buruk pekerjaan yang telah mereka kerjakan.
text.7:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini diterangkan golongan yang menerima catatan dengan tangan kanannya yang berisi apa-apa yang telah dikerjakannya, maka ia akan dihisab dengan mudah dan ringan. Dipaparkanlah semua perbuatannya yang baik dan yang buruk, kemudian diberi ganjaran atas perbuatannya yang baik dan dimaafkanlah perbuatannya yang buruk.

Dalam sebuah hadis Nabi saw dijelaskan:

Dari 'Aisyah, ia berkata, "Aku mendengar Rasulullah saw. berdoa dalam sebagian salat yang dilakukannya, "Wahai Allah, hisablah aku dengan hisab yang mudah". Ketika Rasul selesai salat, aku berkata: "Wahai Nabi Allah, apakah hisab yang mudah itu? Rasulullah menjawab, "Hisab yang mudah adalah ketika Allah memeriksa catatan amal seseorang, Dia memaafkan. Wahai 'Aisyah, orang yang diinterogasi pada perhitungan amalnya di hari itu (Hari Kiamat), maka ia celaka. Dan setiap musibah yang menimpa seorang mukmin, Allah akan mengampuni (dosanya) dengan musibah itu, walau hanya sekedar tertusuk duri." (Riwayat Ahmad)

Maksud Rasulullah dengan perhitungan yang mudah ialah dimaafkan segala kesalahannya, sedangkan orang yang diperiksa catatannya dengan teliti adalah orang yang mendapat malapetaka. Barang siapa mendapat perhitungan yang mudah dan ringan, ia akan kembali kepada keluarganya yang mukmin dengan gembira sebagaimana firman Allah:

Adapun orang yang kitabnya diberikan di tangan kanannya, maka dia berkata, "Ambillah, bacalah kitabku (ini). Sesungguhnya aku yakin bahwa (suatu saat) aku akan menerima perhitungan terhadap diriku." Maka orang itu berada dalam kehidupan yang diridai. (al-haqqah/69: 19-21)

Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa golongan kedua adalah mereka yang banyak mengerjakan perbuatan maksiat, durhaka, dan tidak diridai Allah. Mereka akan menerima catatan perbuatan mereka dengan tangan kiri, dan dari belakang, kemudian mereka dimasukkan ke dalam neraka.

Dan adapun orang yang kitabnya diberikan di tangan kirinya, maka dia berkata, "Alangkah baiknya jika kitabku (ini) tidak diberikan kepadaku. Sehingga aku tidak mengetahui bagaimana perhitunganku. Wahai, kiranya (kematian) itulah yang menyudahi segala sesuatu. Hartaku sama sekali tidak berguna bagiku. Kekuasaanku telah hilang dariku." (al-haqqah/69: 25-29)

text.13:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan bahwa ada dua hal yang menjadi sebab mengapa mereka menerima catatan amalnya dengan tangan kiri, yaitu: pertama, mereka berbuat sekehendak hatinya, mengerjakan kejahatan dan kemaksiatan dengan tidak memikirkan akibat buruk yang akan menimpa mereka di akhirat kelak.

Kedua, mereka menyangka bahwa mereka tidak akan kembali kepada Tuhannya dan tidak akan dibangkitkan kembali untuk dihisab dan menerima hasil perbuatan mereka di dunia.
text.14:

Kedua, mereka menyangka bahwa mereka tidak akan kembali kepada Tuhannya dan tidak akan dibangkitkan kembali untuk dihisab dan menerima hasil perbuatan mereka di dunia.
text.15: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa mereka sesungguhnya akan kembali kepada-Nya dan akan menerima hasil perbuatan mereka di dunia. Orang yang saleh dan patuh mengerjakan perintah-Nya akan dimasukkan ke dalam surga, sedang orang yang durhaka dan banyak berbuat maksiat akan dimasukkan ke dalam neraka.
text.16:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah bersumpah dengan cahaya merah pada waktu senja, dengan malam dan apa-apa yang diselubunginya dan dengan bulan apabila jadi purnama bahwa sesungguhnya manusia melalui tahap demi tahap dalam kehidupan, dari setetes air mani sampai dilahirkan.

Kemudian melalui masa kanak-kanak, remaja dan dewasa sampai tua. Kemudian dari hidup sampai mati, lalu dibangkitkan kembali, hidup kembali di surga atau neraka setelah melalui ujian dan perhitungan yang sangat teliti.

text.20:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah mencela sikap dan perbuatan mereka, "Mengapa mereka masih tidak mau beriman, sedangkan bukti telah nyata menunjukkan adanya hari kebangkitan itu?" Firman Allah:

Orang-orang yang kafir mengira, bahwa mereka tidak akan dibangkitkan. Katakanlah (Muhammad), "Tidak demikian, demi Tuhanku, kamu pasti dibangkitkan, kemudian diberitakan semua yang telah kamu kerjakan." Dan yang demikian itu mudah bagi Allah. (at-Tagabun/64: 7)
text.21: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa mereka tidak mau mengakui bahwa Al-Qur'an itu kalam Ilahi yang harus dimuliakan dan dipatuhi serta mengakui bahwa sesungguhnya Nabi Muhammad saw utusan Allah.
text.22: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa mereka tidak mau mengakui bahwa Al-Qur'an itu kalam Ilahi yang harus dimuliakan dan dipatuhi serta mengakui bahwa sesungguhnya Nabi Muhammad saw utusan Allah.
text.23:
Dalam ayat-ayat berikut ini, Allah menerangkan sebab mereka tidak mau mengakuinya, yaitu:

1.Mereka dengki kepada Nabi Muhammad atas kelebihan yang telah dikaruniakan Allah kepadanya.

2.Mereka takut kehilangan pengaruh dan kedudukan sebagai pemimpin bangsanya.

3.Mereka tidak mau mengganti kepercayaan yang telah dianut oleh nenek moyang mereka dengan kepercayaan yang lain. Allah mengetahui apa yang mereka sembunyikan dalam hati mereka. Oleh karena itu, Allah mengejek mereka dengan kata-kata, "Berilah kabar gembira kepada mereka dengan azab yang pedih di hari Kiamat nanti."
text.24:

2.Mereka takut kehilangan pengaruh dan kedudukan sebagai pemimpin bangsanya.

3.Mereka tidak mau mengganti kepercayaan yang telah dianut oleh nenek moyang mereka dengan kepercayaan yang lain. Allah mengetahui apa yang mereka sembunyikan dalam hati mereka. Oleh karena itu, Allah mengejek mereka dengan kata-kata, "Berilah kabar gembira kepada mereka dengan azab yang pedih di hari Kiamat nanti."
text.25: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya, percaya kepada Al-Qur'an, serta mengerjakan ajarannya dengan sebaik-baiknya, akan mendapat ganjaran dari Allah yang tidak ada putus-putusnya, abadi selama-lamanya.

en.name: The Cleaving Asunder
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: In these verses, Allah explains that when the sky is split open because the connections between its parts have been broken due to the disruption of the laws of the universe on the Day of Judgement, this is caused by the collision of stars in the sky, each possessing its own gravitational pull. Consequently, the laws of the universe will be disrupted, and dark, dense clouds will arise in several places in outer space, and the sky will be obedient to what Allah commands. It is fitting that it should be obedient because it is a creation of God that is always under His power.
text.2: In these verses, Allah explains that when the sky is split open because the connections between its parts have been broken due to the disruption of the laws of the universe on the Day of Judgment, this will be caused by the collision of stars in the sky, each possessing its own gravitational pull. text.3:
Furthermore, Allah explains that when the earth and mountains are crushed into pieces until they become level and bring forth what is inside their "wombs," it is because of their submission to Allah's command and their obedience in carrying out His will.

In other verses, Allah says:

When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake, And the earth discharges its burdens. (az-Zalzalah/99: 1-2)

And when the graves are overturned. (al-Infithar/82: 4)

Then does he not know when the contents of the graves are scattered? (al-'Adiyat/100: 9)

For the tafsir on the phrase "the sky is split open" above, refer back to the scientific study of Surah al-Insyiqaq/84:1-5, and also see the scientific study of Surah al-Haqqah/69:16 and Surah al-Infithar/82:1. Then, the following phrase: "...and has responded to its Lord, and was obligated [to do so]," contains the understanding that this event occurs according to *sunnatullah*, which is according to the laws of Allah that exist in this universe. The meaning of "the earth is leveled, and throws out what is within it and becomes empty" is that the earth is truly devastated, whether due to a collision with a planet or other celestial body, or due to the loss or disruption of gravity. This devastation of the earth is what also causes the entire contents of the earth to be vomited out and leaves the earth empty. Then, the following phrase: "...and has responded to its Lord, and was obligated [to do so]," contains the understanding that this event occurs according to *sunnatullah*, which is according to the laws of Allah that exist in this universe.

text.6: In this verse, Allah reveals that humans, throughout their lives, work diligently to achieve their aspirations. Every step a person takes is actually leading towards the end of their life, which is death. This means returning to Allah. Therefore, humans will come to know about the good and bad deeds they have done.
text.7:
In these verses, it is explained about the group who receive their record with their right hand, containing everything they have done. They will be judged with ease and leniency. All their good and bad deeds will be presented, then they will be rewarded for their good deeds and forgiven for their bad deeds.

In a hadith of the Prophet (peace be upon him) it is explained:

From 'Aisyah, she said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) supplicating in some of the prayers he performed, "O Allah, reckon me with an easy reckoning." When the Messenger finished praying, I said: "O Prophet of Allah, what is the easy reckoning?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "The easy reckoning is when Allah examines a person's record of deeds, and He forgives. O 'Aisyah, whoever is interrogated during the reckoning of his deeds on that day (the Day of Judgment), then he is doomed. And every misfortune that befalls a believer, Allah will forgive (his sins) with that misfortune, even if it is only being pricked by a thorn." (Narrated by Ahmad)

The Prophet's intention with easy reckoning is that all his mistakes are forgiven, while the person whose record is examined carefully is the one who suffers calamity. Whoever receives an easy and lenient reckoning, he will return to his believing family with joy, as Allah says:

"Then as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record! Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account." So he will be in a pleasant life." (al-Haqqah/69: 19-21)

text.10:
In these verses, Allah explains that the second group is those who commit many acts of disobedience, rebellion, and are not pleasing to Allah. They will receive the record of their deeds in their left hand, and from behind, then they will be thrown into Hell.

And as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record, And had not known what my account was. I wish it had been the decisive one. My wealth has not availed me. My authority has departed from me." (al-Haqqah/69: 25-29)
text.11:
In these verses, Allah explains that the second group is those who commit many acts of disobedience, rebellion, and are not pleasing to Allah. They will receive the record of their deeds in their left hand, and from behind, then they will be cast into Hell.

And as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record, and had not known what my account was. I wish it had been the decisive one. My wealth has not availed me, and my authority has departed from me." (al-haqqah/69: 25-29)
text.12:
In these verses, Allah explains that the second group is those who commit many acts of disobedience, rebellion, and things that are not pleasing to Allah. They will receive the record of their deeds in their left hand, and from behind, then they will be thrown into hell.

And as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record. And had not known what my account was. Oh, I wish it had been the decisive one. My wealth has not availed me. My authority has perished from me." (al-haqqah/69: 25-29)
text.13:
In these verses, Allah explains that there are two reasons why they receive their record of deeds in their left hand, namely: first, they acted according to their own desires, committing evil and disobedience without thinking about the bad consequences that would befall them in the Hereafter.

Second, they assumed that they would not return to their Lord and would not be resurrected to be reckoned with and receive the results of their actions in the world.
text.14:
In these verses, Allah explains that there are two reasons why they receive their record of deeds in their left hand, namely: first, they acted according to their own desires, committing evil and disobedience without thinking about the bad consequences that would befall them in the Hereafter.

Second, they assumed that they would not return to their Lord and would not be resurrected to be reckoned with and receive the results of their actions in the world.
text.15: In this verse, Allah affirms that they will indeed return to Him and will receive the consequences of their deeds in the world. The righteous and obedient who carry out His commands will be admitted into Paradise (Jannah), while the disobedient and those who commit many sins will be admitted into Hell (Jahannam).
text.16:
In these verses, Allah swears by the red glow at twilight, by the night and what it envelops, and by the moon when it is at its full (state), that indeed mankind passes through stage after stage in life, from a drop of semen until being born.

Then passing through childhood, adolescence, and adulthood until old age. Then from life to death, then being resurrected, living again in Paradise or Hell after undergoing a very thorough examination and reckoning.
text.17:
In these verses, Allah swears by the red glow at twilight, by the night and what it envelops, and by the moon when it is at its full that indeed mankind passes through stage after stage in life, from a drop of semen until being born.

Then passing through childhood, adolescence, and adulthood until old age. Then from life to death, then being resurrected again, living again in paradise or hell after undergoing trials and a very meticulous reckoning.
text.18:

Then passing through childhood, adolescence, and adulthood until old age. Then from life to death, then resurrected again, living again in paradise or hell after undergoing a very thorough test and reckoning.
text.19:
In these verses, Allah swears by the red glow at twilight, by the night and what it envelops, and by the moon when it is at its full. [He swears] that indeed, mankind passes through stage after stage in life, from a drop of semen until being born.

Then [mankind passes] through childhood, adolescence, and adulthood until old age. Then from life to death, then resurrected again, living again in paradise or hell after passing through a very thorough examination and reckoning.
text.20:
In this verse, Allah censures their attitude and actions, "Why are they still unwilling to believe, when the evidence clearly shows the existence of the Day of Resurrection?" Allah says:

Those who disbelieve think they will never be resurrected. Say, [O Muhammad], "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy." (at-Tagabun/64: 7)
text.21: In this verse, Allah explains that they do not want to acknowledge that the Qur'an is the word of Allah (kalam Ilahi) which must be honored and obeyed, and they do not want to acknowledge that indeed the Prophet Muhammad (saw) is the Messenger of Allah.
text.22: In this verse, Allah explains that they do not want to acknowledge that the Qur'an is the word of Allah (kalam Ilahi) which must be revered and obeyed, and they do not want to acknowledge that indeed the Prophet Muhammad (saw) is the Messenger of Allah.
text.23:
In the following verses, Allah explains the reasons why they refused to acknowledge the truth, which are:

1. They envied Prophet Muhammad for the blessings that Allah had bestowed upon him.

2. They feared losing their influence and position as leaders of their people.

3. They were unwilling to replace the beliefs that their ancestors had adhered to with other beliefs. Allah knows what they conceal in their hearts. Therefore, Allah mocks them with the words, "Give them glad tidings of a painful punishment on the Day of Resurrection."
text.24:

2. They feared losing their influence and position as leaders of their people.

3. They were unwilling to replace the beliefs that their ancestors had adhered to with other beliefs. Allah knows what they conceal in their hearts. Therefore, Allah mocks them with the words, "Give them glad tidings of a painful punishment on the Day of Resurrection."
text.25: In this verse, Allah explains that those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, believe in the Qur'an, and practice its teachings in the best possible way, will receive a reward from Allah that is never-ending, eternal forever.
